body_html:
Or am I misunderstanding you?

If your OCL 1.2 support relies on the mandatory support of SPIR 1.2, I assumed dropping this latter also inversely entailed dropping opencl 1.2 compatibility.

@rodburns could we maybe get this updated with the next release? These are all useful hints for our documentation.

I'm also in the process of *finally* getting to test one of the said arch fglrx platforms (on kernel 4.14 nonetheless) running a humble AMD E-350* [that for as much a low power apu, still has a fully fledged gpu (yes I'm looking at you intel)]
Might you be interested to results?

*quite distant from your fury - but hell, if this works, no reason for everything in-between not to

body:
> Or am I misunderstanding you?

If your OCL 1.2 support relies on the mandatory support of SPIR 1.2, I assumed dropping this latter also inversely entailed dropping opencl 1.2 compatibility. 

> @rodburns could we maybe get this updated with the next release? These are all useful hints for our documentation.

I'm also in the process of *\*finally\** getting to test one of the said arch fglrx platforms (on kernel 4.14 nonetheless) running a humble AMD E-350* [that for as much a low power apu, still has a fully fledged gpu (*yes I'm looking at you intel*)]
Might you be interested to results?

*quite distant from your fury - but hell, if this works, no reason for everything in-between not to
